rComments: Be prepared to read a full chapter envy night for homework. As others have said he is very disorganized and therefore the class was very difficult. Midterms were very specific and poorly worded, and a lot of students had to ask questions. Best to stick to a regular lecture class unless you're good at learning completely on your own.

Ian was a very unclear professor. Yes, it was his first time teaching which would make many think he is open to advice yet he never took any. Ian basically did what he wanted when he wanted. Never lectures and makes you read one chapter every time you meet.  Scratches the surface of Bio he does not prepare you at all for upper div. bio courses.

It was difficult to know what to study for when it came to the exams, and they focused too much on certain things, while other essential biology topics were not even covered during class. Class activities where very unorganized and there was no feedback provided for grades received. But i do think theres hope...
He was very disorganized and really bad at providing feedback. His class activities were very unclear and were graded toughly.

Very disorganized and shaky teacher, kind of condescending, completely confusing and his assignments/tests are poorly written. I love biology but this class was so painful. I get that it was his first time teaching, but the quality of the class was so horrible. He took "active learning" too far/the wrong way, and did not listen to students well.
